title: House Votes To Repeal ACA, Though Bill Unlikely To Pass Senate
teaser: The House has voted to repeal the Affordable Care Act, the first such full repeal vote in two nearly two years. Some 19 million Americans would lose health coverage under the legislation. The bill, though, is not likely to pass the Senate, where a half dozen Democrats would have to go along with it. President Obama has also promised to veto legislation that undoes his signature achievement.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
